title: LTE Smartphone Market in APAC to Grow at 58.57% CAGR By 2019
text:
The report titled LTE Smartphone Market – APAC Outlook (2015-19) showcases an in-depth analysis of the market in terms of market size in APAC, average price and shipments. This report also forecasts the growth numbers till 2019 (on a YoY basis) and hence suggests the Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) for the estimated period.
Mobile broadband penetration to impact LTE smartphone adoption
Smartphones have gradually evolved over the past few years in APAC region with countries like China, India, South Korea and Australia dominating the adoption rates. Companies are focusing on providing faster data accessible networks to respond to the demand for faster data access. While a few regions in APAC like China, South Korea have a developed LTE infrastructure, LTE is yet to evolve in regions like India. The immensely populated region offers a high commercial potential for device manufacturers and telecom providers.
APAC is home to a number of smartphone vendors like Xiaomi, Oppo, OnePlus, Lenovo etc. dedicated to tap the growing user base for smartphones. Home-grown mobile companies in China have started providing affordable feature rich handsets with latest technologies like 4G, which has attracted huge user base in the region. Companies like Micromax, Karbonn Mobiles are planning to invest millions into device manufacturing plants on foreseeing the market opportunity.
Smartphone market has leap-frogged from one generation to another very quickly in this region. LTE smartphones are priced modestly in this region sacrificing certain features like camera, RAM and other hardware. The major drivers impacting adoption in the region is increased broadband penetration. Faster LTE services will encourage users to upgrade their handsets as quickly as possible thereby positively impacting shipments in the region.
